messageBody:
I ran my tests with the 'java -verbose:class' flag which shows class loader info. It shows my classes being loaded by the VM's class loader. From what I understand, JUnit uses it's own class loader in certain situations. I'm wondering if it's a problem with JUnit's class loader.

I'm running my tests by creating a main method in my test class which creates a
TestSuite object and calls the run method on the suite. In other words, I'm not using the TextRunner to run my tests. I had the same problems with the TextRunner.

I'm also hardcoding the servialVersionUID in my classes. The way the serialVersionUID is calculated is by creating a hashcode based on the definition of the class. I'm making an educated guess here that it's somehow getting an empty class definition which yields an ID of 0. (As I said before, I'm hard coding the ID so that also leads me to believe that somehow the class def is not being loaded properly).

Very strange.

Subject: [junit] Problems testing an app that uses java serialization


I think this is a classloader problem but I'm not sure.

I'm trying to test my app using junit. My app is distributed and uses
serialization to send java objects over the wire. When I run my tests from
within Forte they work fine. When I run them from the command line I get a
InvalidClassException stating the serialVersionUID of my class is 0, which
doesn't match the receiving version ID of the class. The id of 0 makes me
think that for some reason my serialized classes aren't being loaded
properly. For one thing I'm defining the serialVersionUID myself and it's
not 0.

My application seems to work perfectly except for the class version
problem so the classes are being loaded at least by the VM's default class
loader (and it works from within forte!?).

Has anyone ever seen this behaviour?

Any ideas would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Rich
